body:
- [x] REST API
- [x] Put websockets behind authentication
- [ ] Tests!

Love that this keeps the `env` settings that are set at the time of launching `ipython notebook`. vim works well and the overall shell experience is pretty nice!

![termjs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4519980/7abc4518-4cd4-11e4-80cc-788c83a52fda.gif)
Bit of an oddity - at least on the Mac I can't seem to copy paste. Tried command-c, ctrl-c, shift-ctrl-c.
Interesting note about environment variables sticking around: if you have a running SSH agent, you'll be able to SSH with your keys.

Since the terminal initialization gets done separately from the handlers initalization, it misses the `base_url` finagling.

```
# prepend base_url onto the patterns that we match
new_handlers = []
for handler in handlers:
        pattern = url_path_join(settings['base_url'], handler[0])
        new_handler = tuple([pattern] + list(handler[1:]))
        new_handlers.append(new_handler)
```
@rgbkrk I have, I hope, just fixed the problem described in your last comment.

Looks like the redirect from `/terminals/new` is a bit too greedy:

![termjs_issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4520629/2f438f10-4cf7-11e4-95f2-ee3327980cd7.gif)

The only other issue I'm facing now is that require.js is having trouble loading the term.js javascripts. It's sitting on the filesystem too, maybe that too is relying on an absolute path. I'll check that out.

![screen shot 2014-10-05 at 8 30 48 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4520681/a3edcd2a-4cf8-11e4-9401-fc52228e2044.png)

If I get both issues nailed, I'll submit a PR to your PR.

Good point, I'd forgotten about relative URLs. The redirect should be fixed now.

term.js I just added to the require config in the page.html template like all our other JS dependencies. Are you definitely updating the submodules to the correct branch when you build this?
![screen shot 2014-10-05 at 9 02 28 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4520810/dd7c1494-4cfc-11e4-9ff7-d270fa935d0a.png)
Provided that got set up correctly, this is what I have.

Nevermind that, looks like term.js didn't get placed:

![screen shot 2014-10-05 at 9 04 02 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4520814/1b3c6dec-4cfd-11e4-9494-0164eee76e79.png)

Looks like term.js really doesn't exist and didn't get installed as part of the package.

Install happens in the same way our Dockerfile builds our Docker image, which uses

```
pip3 install file:///srv/ipython#egg=ipython[all]
```

Prior to this I make sure terminado is installed.
We just need to add term.js to `setupbase.py` with the rest of the `components` directory to install it.

Happy day!

![screen shot 2014-10-05 at 9 38 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4520947/d876423a-4d01-11e4-91e9-a3696a0e29a3.png)

Patch for you. :wink:

``` diff
diff --git a/setupbase.py b/setupbase.py
index d0495be..eb4620f 100644
--- a/setupbase.py
+++ b/setupbase.py
@@ -162,6 +162,7 @@ def find_package_data():
         pjoin(components, "underscore", "underscore-min.js"),
         pjoin(components, "moment", "moment.js"),
         pjoin(components, "moment", "min","moment.min.js"),
+        pjoin(components, "term.js", "src", "term.js"),
     ])

     # Ship all of Codemirror's CSS and JS
```

Slick.

![term_js_whoa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/836375/4520961/836daa8e-4d02-11e4-9894-544e26d0928a.gif)

The only weirdness I experienced there is that it hangs upon startup waiting for some user input before showing the prompt.
This is so great @takluyver. :smiley: :smile: :smiley_cat: :smiling_imp:
The only thing I'd want at this point is to add terminado to the `ipython[all]` deps.

Adding it to deps might be a bit tricky, because it won't install on Windows. Though, actually, installation might work, even though the module won't load.

Thanks for catching the package data thing - I run directly from the repository, so it worked without that locally. I've applied your fix.
This looks cool!  I'll install this tomorrow to give it a test.
Thanks for taking my patch as an actual patch!

This looks awesome...and also slightly terrifying for a project trying to build a sandboxed version of the notebook.  I realize that enabling such sandboxing is more or less explicitly a non-goal of IPython, but I'd be curious to know if there's a clean way of disabling this functionality without diverging from source.
@ssanderson Currently, on this branch, if you don't have terminado installed it won't setup the terminal handlers.

@rgbkrk gotcha.  Am I correct in understanding that `pip install ipython[all]` on this branch would intstall terminado though?  If that's the case I suppose the fix for me is probably to just manually install the specific requirements I do want to provide.

`pip install ipython[all]` actually won't install terminado on this branch currently. It's what I've asked for though and terminado will likely end up in a PR for the base `ipython/ipython` Docker image as soon as this is merged.

looks nice !

I need a `.terminal > div {margin: -2.5px;}` to not have gap in between line, and I have some issues with coloration in vim where light background seem not to appear either. But I suppose theses are unrelated changes.
![capture d ecran 2014-10-06 a 11 01 28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4523439/6b0cf9ce-4d37-11e4-9d78-2d31d2569ca4.png)
![capture d ecran 2014-10-06 a 11 00 17](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/335567/4523440/6b0ed9c4-4d37-11e4-983b-4374a6fcaeaa.png)

Hum, appear to be issues with my specific colorscheme. default one works.

I think we shoudl increase the font-size, but by css it screw the calculated number of columns/rows.
How do you send an interrupt to the terminal?
